questions.question_text: Which network plane is centralized and manages routing decisions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

choices.A: Multiple companies can use the same addresses without conflicts.
choices.C: Communication to the internet is reachable without the use of NAT.
choices.D: All external hosts are provided with secure communication to the internet.
choices.B: Direct connectivity is provided to internal hosts from outside an enterprise network.

questions.question_text: What is a benefit of using private IPv4 addressing?

discussion.content:
You can cross-check the answer using the ip of 10.8.138.14 and broadcast domain 10.8.159.255
In a /19 means you increment by 32 for each network.
The network and new network is 10.8.128.0 - 10.8.160.0. So, the broadcast is correct.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
Finding block size is the easiest method to solve this problem.

Selected Answer: C
From the figure we can see that the broadcast is 10.8.159.255, from this info we can find the network and SM

A. broadcast would be 10.8.255.255/16
B. broadcast would be 10.8.8.127.255/18
C. broadcast would be 0.8.8.159.255/19
D. broadcast would be 10.8.138.255/24

Selected Answer: C
C is right- 100%

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer must provide configured IP addressing details to investigate a firewall rule issue. Which subnet and mask identify what is configured on the en0 interface?

choices.A: It requires 10Gb ports on all uplinks.
choices.E: It requires a core, distribution, and access layer architecture.
choices.D: A router port connects to a broadband connection.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B & D are correct

Selected Answer: BD
Given is correct

B. It supports between 1 and 50 users: SOHO environments are typically designed to serve a small number of users, ranging from a single user (a home office) up to around 50 users in a small office setup.

D. A router port connects to a broadband connection: In SOHO environments, a common setup involves a router connecting to a broadband internet connection, such as DSL, cable, or fiber, to provide internet access to the connected devices in the home or office.

questions.question_text: What are two characteristics of a small office / home office connection environment? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
"Virtualization software - A hypervisor provides management for virtualized services. It enables connections between virtual services and external interfaces."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/enterprise-networks/what-is-virtualization.html#~how-it-works

VMware Engineer here. The correct answer is hypervisor. But that isn't an option. So, there are two types of hypervisors (1 and 2). Both are "technically" software, but 1 is installed on bare metal servers, and 2 is software on top of another OS.
Just an all-around terribly worded question.

Selected Answer: B
I believe B is right.
If Cisco keep testing people with such rubbish questions, CCNA will become a rubbish examination, soon.

Selected Answer: A
it´s A
The Hypervisor

Selected Answer: A
They are talking about the hypervisor
sbnpj: I'm sorry my friend but ChatGPT is often wrong because Ciscs's wording combined with extra correct answers throws it off.

Selected Answer: A
I personally work with virtualization and this is a crap question. It is either A or D. But A has my vote by a long shot.

Selected Answer: A
agree with oatmealturkey "Virtualization software - A hypervisor provides management for virtualized services. It enables connections between virtual services and external interfaces."

comments.content: "Network functionality" has a very broad and far-reaching meaning, so it will always be chosen, but this is not the answer cisco wants. Try removing the letter B and you will see that the letter A. Software will be perfectly chosen!

discussion.content:
As per Chatgpt
The correct answer to the question is B. Network functionality, which refers to the virtualized network components responsible for managing and directing traffic between virtualized services and external interfaces. This includes elements such as virtual switches, routers, firewalls, and load balancers.

A hypervisor provides management for virtualized services. It enables connections between virtual services and external interfaces. It should include platform management, a virtualization layer, a programmable API, and a health monitoring system

It seems to be A

questions.question_text: Which element of a virtualization solution manages virtualized services and enables connections between virtualized services and external interfaces?
